text:
Adobe has released full-fledged Photoshop for the iPad. Next up Illustrator
04 Nov 2019, 17:15 by Daria Gromova
Full-fledged work with layers and PSD right on the tablet screen.
Adobe officially introduced Photoshop for the iPadOS. The application supports both generations of Apple Pencil styluses and is fully adapted for touch screens. Unlike the free Photoshop Express, this is really a complete replacement for desktop photoshop: finally there is support for layers, brushes and image editing tools.



Here is the complete list of compatible devices:

Original iPad Pro
iPad Pro (12.9 inches);
iPad Pro (10.5 inches);
iPad Pro (9.7-inch)
iPad 5;
iPad mini 4;
iPad Air 2.

A subscription costs $ 9.99 per month. At the same time, you also get 20 GB in the cloud for file synchronization and access to all Creative Cloud fonts. A free trial period of 30 days is also available. For this application, you will need a Creative Cloud account - it can be done for free, while you get 2 GB of space in the cloud.
App Store Adobe Photoshop Developer: Adobe Inc. Price: Free
Adobe also confirmed that full-fledged Illustrator will arrive on the iPad in 2020. As with Photoshop, this editor will receive design changes to make it easier to use on the tablet. In addition, you can photograph your sketch on paper, and the program will help you translate it into a vector image.



Illustrator is currently in a closed beta. You can subscribe to updates not to miss the launch of the public beta and information on the exact release date.
